channel.title: Restricting Items

item.title: Restricting Items
item.dc:creator: @coolman44445 coolman44445
item.description:
@coolman44445 wrote:

alancarr123:

Just checking that you saved, compile and restarted your server?

Of course, I’m not stupid ;)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 24, 2009, 07:03:11 am[/size][hr]Worked it out! W00T!

ill make a little tutorial 4 it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 24, 2009, 07:12:34 am[/size][hr]TUTORIAL on Restricting Items.

go to your client.java, and search it (ctr+F)
search for:

int CLRanged = GetCLRanged(wearID);

Under that line: int CLRanged = GetCLRanged(wearID);
You put: int CLMembers = GetCLMembers(wearID);

then search again, now for:

            if (playerLevel[playerRanged] - CLRanged < 0) {
                sendMessage(
                        "You need " + CLRanged + " " + statName[playerRanged]
                        + " to equip this item.");
                GoFalse = true;
            }

under that line you paste this:

            if (CLMembers > playerIsMember) {
                    sendMessage("That item is Restricted.");
                    GoFalse = true;
                        }

next thing you do is search this:

        if (ItemName.startsWith("Magic Cape")) {
            return 99;
        }
        return 1;
    }

under that line, you paste this:


    public int GetCLMembers(int ItemID) {
        if (ItemID == -1) {
            return 0;
        }
       //String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
        if (ItemID == 773) { //perfect ring
            return 1;
        }
        return 0;
    }

Change 773 to any item number that you want to restrict.

Keep in mind, this only works if you have members enabled on your server, and you only want to use the member-non member to restrict items or making member zones.

I hope this helps ya

Credits:
20% Java
39% Maul’s R US Source (for some codes)
41% ME

Read full topic

item.title: Restricting Items
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“coolman44445, post:8, topic:264014”]okay, worked some stuff out:

    if (playerRights >= 2 && wearID == 773) {
      } if (playerRights < 2 && wearID == 773) {
            sendMessage("This ring is Restricted");
	    return false;
     }

yet another problem: you’re still able to wear it >.< I guess the return false doesnt work?[/quote]
Why do you have 2 if statements? Make it look like this,

if (playerRights < 2 && wearID == 773) {
    sendMessage("This ring is Restricted");
    return false;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Restricting Items
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“coolman44445, post:6, topic:264014”]well, you couldn’t wear it if you werent admin +, so that worked fine. Tbh, this code sucks, I’ve changed it to this:

    }
 	if (playerRights >= 2) {
        if (wearID == 773);
      } if (playerRights < 2) {
        && (wearID == 773);
              sendMessage("You have to be admin+ to wear this!");
              remove(playerEquipment[playerRing], playerRing);
return false;
   }

and now it’ll show that with ANY ring… any idea’s how to fix that?[/quote]
You’ve got semi colons at the end of the if statements.

          if (playerRights < 2 && wearID == 773) {
	     return false;
         }

Try that.

Read full topic

@coolman44445 wrote:

well, you couldn’t wear it if you werent admin +, so that worked fine. Tbh, this code sucks, I’ve changed it to this:

    }
 	if (playerRights >= 2) {
        if (wearID == 773);
      } if (playerRights < 2) {
        && (wearID == 773);
              sendMessage("You have to be admin+ to wear this!");
              remove(playerEquipment[playerRing], playerRing);
return false;
   }

and now it’ll show that with ANY ring… any idea’s how to fix that?

item.title: Restricting Items
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“coolman44445, post:1, topic:264014”]so, I want to restrict my perferct ring to admin+ only
I’ve made this code:

if (playerRights >=2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Zazima Souck")) { playerEquipment[wearID] = 773; } else if (playerRights < 2) { sendMessage( "You have to be admin+ to wear this!"); return false; }

and it worked, but where do I have to place it? I did something wrong and I couldn’t wear any item or I would get kicked, I removed this code and it was all fine. But now it doesnt restrict anymore, so where do I have to place this??

Sincerally,
Coolman44445 aka Zazima Souck[/quote]

Right, you said

and it worked
but how can you know it works if you don’t know where to place it.

Anyway, place it in your wear(int) method.

Read full topic

and it worked, but where do I have to place it? I did something wrong and I couldn’t wear any item or I would get kicked, I removed this code and it was all fine. But now it doesnt restrict anymore, so where do I have to place this??

Sincerally,
Coolman44445 aka Zazima Souck
